website_summaries.verdict: Dog dental chews made from apples, oranges, and bananas are easy to digest and reduce plaque and tartar through mechanical chewing action.
pros: Formula helps to reduce plaque and tartar through chewing and mechanical abrasion
All-natural ingredients, good source of vitamin E, and tasty
Available for dogs of different sizes
Dingo also makes other types of dog treats and chews
cons: No preservatives, so chews must be used promptly or they'll spoil

customer_reviews.title: Choking hazard!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely horrified after my dog choked on these bones twice and almost died! I am a veterinarian and was able to remove the obstruction but seeing her in a state of panic, not able to breathe, furiously pawing at her mouth, and turning purple was absolutely traumatizing. I thought the first time was because she tried to eat the bone whole, but the second time I realized that the bone starts disintegrating and becoming gummy, which then got stuck of the back of her mouth and she couldn’t swallow it. I will never give these treats again and hope no one else does either!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Castillo

customer_reviews.title: 1 of 2 likes them a lot, the other will eat it eventually
customer_reviews.text: My girl really likes these. She's pretty happy with most Dingo products. I'm not sure about the consistency of these...Kind of a weird plastic-y brittle. I would normally only give half if I were unsure about a treat, but they're too hard to snap so she ends up getting the whole thing. There haven't been any tummy issues so I guess it's all good. The chihuahua is usually hesitant to go for it, but as soon as he sees my girl start in on hers, he'll start in on his. Again, no tummy issues from these so all seems well. They seem a little big for a 20lb chihuahua, but they're the perfect size for a 35lb terrier.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Better breath
customer_reviews.text: Not only do these dental chews help improve our dogs’ breath (with daily use), but our dogs enjoy these so much that we have to supervise them so that the smaller dog’s treat isn’t stolen. It’s also great that they don’t affect their digestion negatively, which other chews and treats have done.
customer_reviews.author: PS Forster

customer_reviews.title: My dogs favorite
customer_reviews.text: Its like crack for dogs! He loves them over jerkey and all the other treats I buy him! Breath smells better too! I still buy the small dog Dingo bones and twists, but this is his favorite and he will only eat the others when I run out of these!
customer_reviews.author: IAM4LSU

customer_reviews.title: 2 Picky dogs like them, and a solid value for the money
customer_reviews.text: For smaller to medium dogs these are good treats for the teeth. you get 2 dozen, they won't last too long depending on the dogs but great in between type snacks or before bed snacks to help the tartar from building up too much. Love them as add ons!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M

customer_reviews.title: My dogs we're kind of on and off with them
customer_reviews.text: I only gave you three stars because they're made for small breed dogs but are really hard. My dogs didn't seem to care for them because they were so hard. Now if you have a dog that likes hard treats then they will work well they smell great but again are hard.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Laskowski

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Although our dogs are large, they don't like the large size Dingo Denta Treats. They like this mini size and get two each morning. Their teeth have stayed clean and their breath fresh. This is their favorite brand, other brands they just refused to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Leaf Hopper

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I love original dingo for my dogs. However PLEASE BE AWARE , these are extremely dangerous especially for little dogs. They can , have and will choke ur dog if they aren’t monitored. And that being said these should be off the market.
customer_reviews.author: dana S

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes them
customer_reviews.text: The smell of the treat is not minty or anything like i expected. It does have a chewy/thick rubber type feel to them. The dog really enjoys them and has no complaints. Hoping the continued use make an improvement on his teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Boba Fatale

customer_reviews.title: Don't feed other dogs,that don't belong to you.
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs refused to eat it,so I just passed it on to some neighbors dogs. I know 1 of my neighbors dog ate it,but I felt bad he threw up that same night. I wouldn't buy it again. Lesson learned
customer_reviews.author: Magda T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for doggy breath
customer_reviews.text: My dogs enjoy eating these. The love a variety of products made by Dingo. And they do help freshen their breath.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tasty treat to clean his teeth
customer_reviews.text: I like them so did my dog but I thought they were smaller. I have bought the next size down didn't realize they were bigger. I have to break them in half for him. They are harder for him to eat otherwise their great.
customer_reviews.author: Laurena J Vande Weerd

customer_reviews.title: A Treat dogs LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Our little Chiweenie gets one bone that we hide for her to find at bedtime. It is something she loves more than any food or treat. We have to give her thyroid half a tab, twice a day. She actually begs for the pill so she can be praised as a good girl and get that bone before she sleeps.
customer_reviews.author: GabbyRob

customer_reviews.title: 24 pack Dingo Mini Denta-Treats
customer_reviews.text: I normally order the Checkups Dental dog treats and divide them into thirds to give to my three bichons who really love them. This time I ordered the Dingo Mini Denta-treats because they saved me a little money versus the Checkups and as near as I could tell the ingredients seemed to be almost the same. I am not sure my three fluffs like them as well as the Checkups which they will chew right away. They seemed to leave them alone until they realized they weren't going to be offered anything else and later they would finally consume them. It was worth a try and perhaps other dogs won't be as picky as are my three.
customer_reviews.author: Diana A

customer_reviews.title: Great for their oral health!
customer_reviews.text: Our two boys, Bichon Frise and a Poodle, love these! They've got the right amount of crunch, not too hard but not too crumbly. I know it works at keeping their teeth clean since our vet always comments on their good oral health, despite the fact that we're not the most consistent parents when it comes to brushing their teeth... *lays head down in shame * I give them each one Dingo after their home made dinner. Dingo has become the "treat" word around here :-)
customer_reviews.author: Barbara V.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were going to be minty based on the packaging shown but they are not. It arrived in blue packaging, original flavor. My dogs love these but even my 8 lb dog devours this in about 2 minutes, so it really doesn't serve any use as a teeth cleaning dental chew. Also, my other dog throws up if she has too much. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Puppy crack
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE these bones. They don’t want the dingo twist sticks anymore. All they want are these dental bones
customer_reviews.author: Owright

customer_reviews.title: Tear into TARTAR for Tooth care on your little breed dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Woof woof wooof wof.... CHIHUAHUA BARKING translated to “ Nice Bone for my little mouth & I don’t even know it helps clean away Tartar too!”
customer_reviews.author: DEBBS

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My little dog she loves them. for the taste Well I have never ate one I leave that to my Dog. she likes all the snacks that I get for her..
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Not American Made
customer_reviews.text: Did not notice but product is made in Thailand, needless to say it went in the garbage. I only buy American Made for my precious pet.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Mata

customer_reviews.title: Clean my teeth!!
customer_reviews.text: 7 years of giving these to my Yorkies and yearly cleaning has kept their chompers in excellent condition.

customer_reviews.title: She loves them, I love the price!
customer_reviews.text: My sweet pupperoni loves these! At almost 11 years old, her teeth are awesome.

customer_reviews.title: Dingo dental treats whitening
customer_reviews.text: The small dog bone shaped ones with whitening seem to clean fine but they smell terrible. The chicken liver smell is almost as bad as dog breath.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: My Pugs Luv Denta Treats!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our two pugs, ages 4 and 14, love Denta Treats! They get them as "dessert" at the end of each meal, and at special times (you know, when they go potty, at the end of play time, and just about any time they wag their tails)... Unfortunately, stores like Pet Smart have stopped carrying them, and even Target stores don't keep their stock supplied. Thank goodness for Amazon.com. I can always count on them to come thru for me/the pugs....
customer_reviews.author: George from Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My dogs always love these treats. Especially great for dogs that dont like the green treats.

customer_reviews.title: Small treats that my dog loved!
customer_reviews.text: My border collie loved these. They're small, but I wanted to keep his treats as small as possible so they were perfect.

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother purchasing these. They turned rock hard after my first time opening bag. My dogs had issues bitting into them. Not worth the price and health of the dog

customer_reviews.title: picky dog likes them
customer_reviews.text: Mr.Tobi likes these not his favorite but will eat them when thats all he got lol

customer_reviews.title: very good product I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed his teeth whiter. And it's removed stains from his teeth. Very good product definitely would recommend this product. And he is very picky. So it must taste good to him.

customer_reviews.title: They’re okay
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them but at the same time she’s a dog. She’ll eat anything. From what i gather of the smell, the flavor isn't all that and it doesn’t really freshen her breath. But there are quite a few treats in the bag and my doggie looks as happy as can be when she’s chewing on them :)

customer_reviews.title: Must have for breath!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. My picky senior dachshund likes them. They have a weird "in package" smell, but work well on the breath. Definitely keep the bag closed when storing.

customer_reviews.title: she does a little happy dance. She LOVES these and I am happy ...
customer_reviews.text: I give these to my dog on Wednesdays and Sundays. So when I ask her, "What day is it? It's Wednesday bone day!", she does a little happy dance. She LOVES these and I am happy that she does too. I had her teeth cleaned around February of 2012. I had a vet check her teeth this past October and he said her teeth looked great. I don't brush her teeth, all I do is give her one of these twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Dog won’t chew it. Not a favorite treat.
customer_reviews.text: I have to cut them in little pieces. Pup won’t just chew it.
customer_reviews.author: oma cox

customer_reviews.title: Fine product
customer_reviews.text: I have two miniature doxies. They absolutely love these chews. The chews helps with cleaning their teeth but not all the way. They still need to have their teeth brushed from time to time. When I gave them the raw hide sticks I would have to stick my finger into Natasha's mouth to pull out the stub to prevent her from choking. Both animals chew these up without that problem. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: 60Plus Something

customer_reviews.title: Not for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend it for older dogs. I was so fearful she was going to break her teeth. If I can't snap it in half, no way is it safe. Luckily my mom's young dogs love them.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them!

customer_reviews.text: My dogs love​ these and it may help with their teeth; however, I can see them in their poop. Once gone, I will not buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Belle's Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Belle gets three treats each day and this is her favorite. This is her morning treat and she makes the most of it. First she licks it all over and then she begins the slow and methodic chewing. She often carries it from room to room and generally makes the treat last 30 minutes or so. We ran out a few weeks ago and she was lost. She wanted no other treat in the a.m.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Barton

customer_reviews.title: Dingos mini treats
customer_reviews.text: These are something my dog loves - I don't know why. They smell funny (kinda bad) and don't seem to be anything special (like cheese or meat). He gets one every day - and goodness help you if you don't have one! If I am not albe to get this kind, he will accept another treat, but he lets you know it's not "his dingo."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ITEM
customer_reviews.text: My puppy absolutely LOVES these. When i leave the house my puppy starts to whine. I live in an apartment complex..so this becomes a problem for the neighbors. Now i just give her one of these before i leave and she is occupied for a good 20 min (She doesn't whine when i am gone...just when she sees me leaving). I just got one package to try them out..i will definitely be buying more!

customer_reviews.title: Great treat - must have

customer_reviews.title: They may be good, but my dogs got upset stomachs!
customer_reviews.text: We tried these treats to help with plaque and tartar. I have two dogs, a Siberian Husky and a Mini Schnauzer. Their vet told us that they should both have treats for their teeth that will help with tartar. We can't really use big bones because the dogs get too aggressive with them. Treats work better. We bought these to try and they seemed okay, but the next day the dogs had very bad upset stomachs. This was the only new thing introduced to their diet so that is why I feel that it was the culprit. They may work, but for my dogs they did not work.

product_meta.title: Dingo Denta Treats Teeth Whitening Mini Chews, 24 Pack
product_meta.description: The Dingo brand combines powerful flavors and benefits to create bones, chews and treats that are sure to keep you and your dog wanting more. With a wide variety of shapes and flavors, there are options for any size companion. We all love puppy Kisses, but bad breath can ruin that pretty quick. Give your dog A chew that they will love, that also helps make their breath better. Tear into tartar care with this fun chew and keep freshness for the future with the resealable bag. Dingo dental chews are daily oral health chews that reduce tartar and plaque and freshen breath from the natural abrasive action of chewing. Dental chews are a good source of protein and give your pup an added source of vitamin E. These chews put a twist on the classic bone shape and are great for small or toy dogs. That's something you and your pup can smile about!
feature_bullets: Cleans And Strengthens Teeth To Support Overall Oral Health
